title: Tottenham provide Hugo Lloris update after sickening injury during Brighton defeat
text:
Hugo Lloris suffered a sickening injury during Tottenham’s defeat to Brighton (Picture: Getty)

Tottenham have confirmed goalkeeper Hugo Lloris suffered a dislocated elbow during the Premier League defeat to Brighton on Saturday.

French World Cup winner Lloris was stretched off and taken to hospital after landing awkwardly on his elbow early into the match.

The injury occurred as Brighton took the lead over Spurs and Mauricio Pochettino’s struggling side could not turn things around as they succumbed to a 3-0 defeat.

A statement from Tottenham read: ‘We can confirm that Hugo Lloris sustained a dislocated elbow during today’s match against Brighton.

The French goalkeeper will be sidelined for some time (Picture: Getty)

‘Our Club Captain was stretchered off as a result of the injury and will now return to London this evening after being assessed at a local hospital.

‘Assessment will continue this coming week to ascertain the full extent of the injury and the length of time he will require to undergo rehabilitation.’

After Neal Maupay’s bizarre opening goal, Brighton doubled their lead through Aaron Connolly midway through the first half.

Any hopes of a Spurs comeback were ended 20 minutes after half-time as Connolly, on his first Premier League start, added Brighton’s third.

The defeat marks the end of a miserable week for Spurs, who were smashed 7-2 by Champions League rivals Bayern Munich on Tuesday.

Pochettino said: ‘It was difficult to assess the team. In the first few moments we conceded and then lost our goalkeeper.

‘It was very negative for the team, the emotion was massive. We did not play well. We are disappointed about that. Brighton played well.

‘We cannot say that they did not deserve the three points. We never recovered from those opening few minutes. We could not change the dynamic of the game.’
